[justify][author]\033MTerracorp[/author]Dear %s,

landed rulers of the Commonwealth are obligated to report Terraformer activities to us. The machines expand from a [red]Maelstrom[/red] in the sector %s. We want your assessment whether this is an existential threat to all biological life in this outer border galaxy.

[yellow]Xenon Crisis Mechanic:[/yellow]
When the galaxy is in danger Terracorp will force everyone to stop their wars and unite in a big coalition. But since Terracorp has to tend to thousands of other galaxies they cannot pay much attention and rely on Xenon reports from all factions.
The undertone of your own Xenon reports can be changed in the [white]personal journal[/white].
Terracorp listens extra carefully to the absolute majority of combined military power in the Commonwealth. Weak factions with Xenon problems often work towards a global coalition. Strong factions want to prevent it. There is a new diplomatic [white]favor action[/white] which allows to write the Xenon reports for other empires.[/justify]

[justify][author]\033MTerracorp[/author]We just received your report about the global Terraformer progress. According to you they are almost at the gates to Terra itself!
Look, its out of the question that your assessment is valuable to us. But we wonder why your report contradicts our own observations so severely. Please remember that we have to consider the state of the entire galaxy and will only react if biological LIFE itself is at stake. According to our other intel sources this doesn't seem to be the case yet.

Maybe you have your own severe problems with the OCV. Be assured that we send our honest condolences. But we simply cannot take away the freedom to wage war in this outer bordre galaxy. At least not yet.

[yellow]The global progress of the Terraformers is simply too low right now. Terracorp will refuse to declare a coalition against them. No sitrep will sway them at this point, even if you'd convince all factions to warn them like you just did. Try again when the Xenon own much more sectors or when the OCV fleet has grown much stronger.[/yellow][/justify]

[author][yellow]Tutorial[/yellow][/author]Terracorp has just declared a global [yellow]Xenon Crisis[/yellow]!

> the main faction wars have stopped! Everyone is allied.
> your permanent wars get suppressed until this crisis is over.
> all sectors are Protectorates with severe consequences if you ignore that
> special bounty rewards for OCV and Xenon kills!
> many volunteers have joined the fight! Terracorp covers three quarters of all mercenary costs!

The United Commonwealth needs to fight the Xenon back to their Maelstrom sector. If you win this war the machines will be crippled for a long time. As you read this, all factions have already started to work hard to achieve this goal. What will you do? This is the time when legends and heroes are born!

[author][yellow]Tutorial[/yellow][/author]Tip: destroying neutral traders to steal their cargo won't get you into major trouble anymore!
However, this adds to your [yellow]Infamy[/yellow] and makes you untrustworthy. Right now you have %s infamy.

WITH Infamy:
[red]- you cannot get truces or buy sectors and favor actions.
[green]+ Pirates will often leave sectors where your freighters are[/green]
[green]+ nomad mercs cannot betray you[/green]
[green]+ Outposts produce more Spaceweed and clients might even come to you to[/green]

WITHOUT Infamy:
[green]+ the Trade Union will frequently bribe you[/green]
[green]+ you can receive sector gifts from the UNC during a Xenon Crisis[/green]

How to GAIN Infamy:> destroying neutral ships, especially refugees.
> breaking truces or common rules

How to LOOSE Infamy:
> slowly decays over time
> the general amnesty after a Xenon Crisis will clear most of it at once.

[author][green]Freelancer Trade Union[/green][/author]You have been registered in our special philantropist program and received %s credits from our Freelancer Relief Fund.

We thank you and hope for lasting partnership.

[yellow]Tutorial:[/yellow]
The neutral traders in this galaxy are organized. They basically just bribed you. Its a reward which gets frequently paid as long as you don't have any infamy.
The amount of credits depends on your combined military power in relation to the other main factions. It won't cover your entire ship maintenance, but it is a reliable secondary income.

The UNC is hereby dissolved!

All sector protectorates will expire in a few hours. Conflicts between former UNC member states are not forbidden anymore.

A general amnesty has been declared.

[author][green]GalNewsNet[/green][/author]The United Commonwealth has declared victory over the dreadful Xenon Empire. The global crisis has come to an end.
Scattered Terraformer remains are getting routed across the entire galaxy. Our brave soldiers will send them back through their hellish Maelstrom in the sector %s. Where they will hopefully stay forever!
Our species have proven that we can stand united side by side. Calls are being made that we should not fall back into old habits of war and the general public is weary of it.

[yellow]Tutorial:[/yellow]
The Terraformers are completely crippled and won't be able to reinforce their fleets for a while. But eventually they will return.
All main empires should be pretty burned out of resources by now. That's why they will probably keep the peace for some time and try to rebuild this galaxy.

[author]Flagship of the Nomad Fleet[/author]Dear inhabitants of this galaxy,

We call ourselves the [yellow]Nomads[/yellow]. We are the last survivors of the countless galaxies that the OCV already destroyed.

Never give up and come to us! We will help and provide ships to you.

[yellow]Tutorial:[/yellow]
The Nomads are a new refugee faction. When the Xenon or OCV destroy a station, a few survivors sometimes manage to escape in a TP. They'll drop off various passengers with their families and sell any resources from their lost home. Then they head off to the Nomad Flagship. It relies on a constant stream of these refugees to be able to build special mobile factory ships and mercenary fleets.

[yellow]Tutorial[/yellow][/author]You have just received %s new people in your %s! They are [yellow]Refugees[/yellow] from a sector which got attacked by the Terraformers.

Refugees will only come to your Outposts if you are honorable and have no infamy. This allows you to exceed your usual population limit by up to the double amount for more Taxes, Waste generation and production speed. But keep in mind that these additional people will cannot regrow naturally if you start building ships which require pilots or if a desease or famine reduces your population.

Harming refugees would quickly turn you into a very famous and very evil person. And you don't want that, don't you?

[author]Flagship of the Nomad Fleet[/author]Fellow Nomads! The time has come for us to take revenge on the Xenon! Onwards, you glorious fighters! Wipe the machines from the face of this galaxy!

Avenge your families!

Honor your fallen brothers and sisters!

ATTACK!

[yellow]Tutorial:[/yellow]
According to the basic law of stupidity, most nomad mercenaries in the galaxy will probably follow this call to arms. The fools are currently betraying their current merc contracts to attack the Xenon Empire all by themselves.
